modules.description: Provides functions for validating and asserting conditions on integer ranges, string formats, and list lengths. Works with int, string, and list types to enforce constraints during runtime. Used to check input validity in parsing routines and data processing pipelines.

Serializes values into string representations and truncates them to approximately 100 characters for concise output. Works with arbitrary OCaml values and their string forms. Useful for logging limited details of complex or large data structures.

Provides boolean and value comparisons, including exact and approximate equality checks for floats, and exception and timeout validation. Works with booleans, numeric types, options, and arbitrary functions. Validates test conditions by ensuring expected outcomes, such as confirming a function raises a specific error or completes within a time limit.
